page.title: 11SCHOOL
page.content: The village school. The first tangible school building was erected in 1836 by the owner of the parish,George Savile Foljambe Esq of Osberton.The Foljambs still own a large part of Sturton parish.The school today is entitled"Sturton-Le -steeple C of E (aided) primary school and it maintains it's strong links with the church.There are 47 pupils on roll.In 1866 and 1879 additions were made and improvements made to the schoolhouse.The latter is now part of the school and is used for classrooms and staffrooms etc.The numbers on roll have fallen steadily over the years and the school was once threatened with closure.The school plays a very active part in village life and it has a very good name educationally.There is an excellent kitchen.
